common.categoryNotFound: This program category does not exist.
common.supportDescription: Join us to build Cameroon's future together.

hero.welcome: Welcome to the platform of the
hero.description: A united political force to transform Cameroon and build the future our nation and its diaspora deserve.

datas.title: Mental and Cultural Revolution
datas.descrip: We are sustainably transforming mindsets to build a modern, inclusive society focused on excellence. Through innovative educational programs and a redefinition of our values, we prepare Cameroonians for the challenges of the 21st century.

datas.title: Structural Economic Transformation
datas.descrip: Our economic plan focuses on diversification, innovation, and the creation of millions of decent jobs. Local industrialization, modern agriculture, and the digital economy are the pillars of our sovereign development.

datas.title: Diaspora Integration and International Influence
datas.descrip: The Cameroonian diaspora is a rich pool of skills and resources. We will create attractive initiatives to encourage the return of talent and investment, making Cameroon a regional leader in strategic sectors.

index.heroDescription: A political and civic movement born from the need to unite all Cameroonian forces around a core principle: the radical transformation of the country.

federation.title: National Federation
federation.descrip: Bringing together all active forces of the nation beyond traditional divisions.

transformProject.title: Transformative Project
transformProject.descrip: A clear vision for a modern and economically strong Cameroon.

index.visionQuote: Building together a prosperous and united Cameroon

stats.description: Our commitment is measured through clear indicators reflecting our holistic vision for Cameroon. Each number represents a structuring axis of our societal project, rooted in local realities and oriented towards the future.

pillars.title: Fundamental Pillars
pillars.description: Democracy, Unity, Progress – the foundations of our national commitment for a strong and prosperous Cameroon.

vision.title: Shared Vision
vision.description: A collective ambition to transform our nation and improve the living conditions of all Cameroonians.

regions.title: Cameroon Regions
regions.description: Balanced representation of all regions, ensuring fairness and harmonious development across the territory.

potential.title: National Potential
potential.description: Exploiting human and natural resources without limits to build the future of our great nation.

stats.footerNote: These indicators are our compass for balanced and sustainable development in Cameroon.

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.description: A participative approach involving citizens, experts, and public/private sectors to create solutions adapted to local realities.

pillars.subtitle: Three fundamental pillars that guide our vision of a transformed and prosperous Cameroon

youth.title: Determined Youth
youth.subtitle: The Force of Change
youth.description: Youth determined to contribute to change, to transform, develop, and modernize Cameroon. This change comes through a mental revolution based on a work ethic, individual responsibility, and the will to break with old patterns that hinder progress.

mindset.title: New Mindset
mindset.subtitle: Reject Fatalism
mindset.description: A new mindset: that of all people who believe that Cameroon has stagnated enough. Those who believe that without resorting to violence, the country can rise to a much more dignified rank among African economic powers.

change.title: Change of Mindset
change.subtitle: Revolution of Behavior
change.description: A call for a change of mindset. It is about creating a critical mass of citizens outraged by the evils that plague our society: corruption, denigration, sabotage, retrograde practices, lack of civility, and cultural uncleanliness.

about.description: The United People’s Party relies on unchanging principles that guide our political action and vision for Cameroon.

federation.title: Federation of Forces
federation.description: The UPP provides a unifying and inclusive framework where all forces of proposal converge, whether from the opposition or the ruling coalition.

vision.title: Transformative Vision
vision.description: Our political project is centered on a profound transformation of Cameroon's economic, social, and political structures.

inclusive.title: Inclusive Approach
inclusive.description: Unlike traditional political formations, the UPP adopts a resolutely inclusive approach that integrates all components of society.

strategy.title: Action Strategy
strategy.description: Our method relies on three strategic pillars to ensure sustainable transformation.

vision.descriptionIntro: Our vision is of a Cameroon that refuses fatalism and relies on
vision.quote: A Cameroon that rises peacefully to a respectable rank among the economic powers of Africa
vision.quoteDescription: The United People’s Party (UPP) brings together those who refuse fatalism and believe in the possible transformation of our country through a responsible and committed new generation.

economicPower.title: African Economic Power
economicPower.description: Position Cameroon among the major economic powers on the continent

diasporaIntegration.title: Diaspora Integration
diasporaIntegration.description: Actively mobilize the Cameroonian diaspora as a driver of transformation

civicEngagement.title: Engaged Civil Society
civicEngagement.description: Build a critical mass of responsible and committed citizens

innovation.title: Innovation and Modernity
innovation.description: Develop a modern, connected, and innovative Cameroon

callToAction.title: Join the Change Revolution
callToAction.description: The UPP aims to bring together the forces of proposal, whether from opposition parties or the government, provided they share this vision of a

locationDetails: Siège National, BP : 8361 Deido, Douala, Cameroun

heros.title: Who are we?
heros.intro2: A civic force for Cameroon’s renewal
heros.desc: Innovative civic movement, the UPP brings together committed Cameroonians to build a prosperous, fair, and united nation through concrete solutions and participatory governance.

histoire.title: Our History
histoire.subtitle: From idea to action: the journey of a generation determined to transform Cameroon

steps.title: Genesis (2025)
steps.desc: Facing a political scene lacking innovation, a group of young Cameroonian professionals created the UPP with a vision: transforming Cameroon through civic engagement, technical expertise, and a participatory approach. Our goal? To propose credible alternatives to national challenges.

steps.title: Expansion (2030)
steps.desc: The UPP becomes a national movement with the participation of the diaspora, sectoral experts, and community leaders. We develop our first concrete projects: civic training programs, thematic think tanks, and intergenerational dialogue platforms. Our advantage? Field approach combined with technical expertise.

steps.title: Governance (2035)
steps.desc: The UPP establishes itself as an essential civic platform with:

histoire.quote: The UPP embodies the hope of a renewed Cameroon, where every citizen becomes an actor of change. Our strength? Turning ideas into concrete actions for the common good.

objectifs.title: Unlock the Potential of Youth
objectifs.subtitle: Empowering young people to shape the future of Cameroon
objectifs.sectionDesc: Providing young Cameroonians with the tools to become agents of change.

items.title: Tailored Training
items.desc: Programs designed to meet local market needs

items.title: Encouraged Innovation
items.desc: Incubators and funding dedicated to youth projects

objectifs.ctaTitle: Ready to contribute to this transformation?

leadership.title: Leadership
leadership.subtitle: Committed and visionary leaders driving Cameroon's transformation

leaders.name: Dr. NGAKETCHA
leaders.description: Visionary and experienced political leader with over 20 years of commitment to Cameroon's development.

hero.subtitle: A project based on intelligence, justice, sovereignty and human progress.

programme.axesSubtitle: Discover our full program to transform Cameroon

axes.title: AXIS 1: INSTITUTIONAL REFOUNDATION
axes.subtitle: Modern, transparent and digital state
items: Presidential term limited to 5 years renewable 3 times
Democratic election of Constitutional Court judges
Democratic election of Supreme Court magistrates
Automation of the electoral system and voting
Legalization of administrative documents within 60 minutes
Creation of a National Order for each profession
Establishment of National Digital ID Card
New license plate linked to digital ID
Reform of national addressing and postal system

axes.title: AXIS 2: NATIONAL SOVEREIGNTY
axes.subtitle: Social justice and economic independence
items: End of trade agreements and economic renegotiation
Withdrawal of mining licenses granted to Chinese companies
Withdrawal of railway concessions from Bolloré
Dissolution of Camair-Co and withdrawal of state airline management
Tax on privately owned urban buildings
Mandatory waste pre-collection and household sorting
Mandatory investigation into extravagant wealth under 35

axes.title: AXIS 3: ECONOMIC MODERNIZATION
axes.subtitle: Industrialization, mobility and innovation
items: Creation of Regional Free Industrial Zones
Ban on importing vehicles over 5 years old
Reconstruction of airports and construction of new ones
Inalienable Land Title and land reform

axes.title: AXIS 4: DIGITAL REVOLUTION
axes.subtitle: AI, knowledge, diaspora and traditions
items: Election of Rectors by academic staff
National Institute of Heritage and Traditions

axes.title: AXIS 5: NATIONAL COHESION
axes.subtitle: Security, mobility and citizenship
items: Strengthening judicial role of the gendarmerie
Mandatory national flag on homes and businesses
Trash Bag Cameroon clean city program

programme.impactSubtitle: Figures that show the scale and precision of our action

stats.label: Citizens impacted
stats.description: Our program will directly impact over 10 million Cameroonians.

stats.label: Concrete measures
stats.description: More than 100 measurable actions with performance indicators.

programme.ctaSubtitle: Together, let's build a fairer, stronger and prouder Cameroon.

heroVision.title: UNITED PEOPLE'S PARTY
heroVision.subtitle: FOR A NEW CAMEROON
heroVision.quote: “There are moments in history when generations have no choice but to rise. Not for the love of power, but out of duty.”

visionVision.description: The UNITED PEOPLE'S PARTY aims to become the main political reference framework for Cameroonian youth, a structured, inclusive, and unifying space.

blocks.title: GOVERNANCE AND PARTICIPATION
blocks.description:
We aim to:
- Create a convergence space for young leaders
- Build a collective force able to influence public debate
- Establish a new political vision based on collaboration and ethics

blocks.title: ELECTORAL STRATEGY
blocks.description:
Our goals:
- Prepare for the 2026 elections
- Pool the strength of committed young people
- Democratically conquer spaces of power
- Build a credible political alternative

blocks.title: TRAINING AND LEADERSHIP
blocks.description:
We will develop:
- A political training school
- A strategic think tank
- A young elected officials incubator
- Networks of local elected officials to promote synergies

values.subtitle: In a Cameroon where more than 70% of the population is under 35, we carry the values of a new political generation

blocks.title: Integrity
blocks.description: We uphold the ethics of truth, justice, and loyalty. Rejecting compromise and duplicity, we commit to embodying honest, consistent, and exemplary politics.

blocks.title: Discipline
blocks.description: We believe in the power of organization, respect for common rules, and self-discipline. Being disciplined means rigor in our actions and responsibility in our behavior.

blocks.title: Excellence
blocks.description: We reject mediocrity. We strive for excellence in thought, action, and in how we represent youth.

blocks.title: Patriotism
blocks.description: Our loyalty goes first to the Cameroonian people. We serve Cameroon, not foreign, family, or partisan interests. The good of the nation guides our struggles and alliances.

blocks.title: Generational solidarity
blocks.description: We move forward together. Our strength lies in unity, mutual trust, and the ability to uplift others. We believe every young person deserves a place, a voice, and an opportunity.

newPolitics.subtitle: The UNITED PEOPLE'S PARTY breaks with traditional practices

cta.subtitle: Join the movement for a new generational governance

hero.title: Contact Us
hero.subtitle: We are here to listen and build the Cameroon of tomorrow together

info.title: Contact Information
info.addressDetails: National Headquarters: BP 8361 Deido, Douala, Cameroon

form.title: Send us a message
form.subtitle: Your questions, suggestions, and proposals matter
form.consent: I agree to be contacted by UPP regarding my request
form.errorConsent: You must agree to be contacted to continue.
form.errorUnexpected: An unexpected error occurred while sending the form.

footer.locationDetails: National Headquarters, PO Box: 8361 Deido, Douala, Cameroon

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.section1Text: UPP collects only the data strictly necessary for the proper functioning of the website and communication with its members or visitors. This data may include:
section2List: Respond to information or contact requests
Manage registrations for activities, events, and newsletters
Improve user experience on the site
Communicate about the party’s actions and proposals
privacy.section2Text: No personal data is sold or shared with third parties for commercial purposes.
privacy.section3Text: The site uses cookies to measure audience traffic and facilitate navigation. You can configure your browser to refuse cookies or be informed of their use.
privacy.section4Title: 4. Right of Access, Modification and Deletion
privacy.section4Text: In accordance with current legislation, each user has the right to access, correct and delete their data. To exercise these rights, please contact us at:
privacy.section5Text: UPP implements technical and organizational measures to protect personal data against unauthorized access, loss, or destruction.
privacy.section6Text: This policy may be modified at any time to comply with changes in legislation or site operations. Any major modification will be clearly announced on the site.

galleries.title: Gallery | United People's Party (UPP)
galleries.description: Exclusive media gallery of United People's Party (UPP) activities

hero.quote: "Our commitment is unwavering: to build a strong, united and prosperous nation where every citizen finds their place and contributes to building a bright future."

content.title: Our Action in Images
content.description: Discover the highlights of our political commitment and the achievements of the United People's Party (UPP) across Cameroon.

descriptions.methodes: Our structured approach to bring sustainable solutions
descriptions.solutions: Our concrete proposals to improve the situation of {{category}}

problemes: Lack of adequate school infrastructure in many regions
High cost of school supplies and tuition fees
Absence of school canteens and feeding programs
Insufficient quality of teaching in some schools
Lack of school transport, particularly in rural areas
Early school dropout due to socio-economic difficulties
Inequalities in access to education between urban and rural regions
methodes: Participatory diagnosis with school communities and parents
Collaboration with local authorities and educational partners
Establishment of community monitoring committees
Continuous needs assessment and program adjustment
Training and awareness-raising for education stakeholders
Creation of public-private partnerships for education
solutions: Construction and rehabilitation of schools in disadvantaged areas
Implementation of a free school supplies program
Creation of school canteens with local products
Continuous teacher training and improvement of their conditions
Development of an accessible school transport system
Scholarships for deserving students from modest families
School support program and psychosocial support
Progressive digitization of teaching with computer equipment

problemes: High tuition fees and little financial support
Lack of access to decent university housing
Mismatch between academic training and labor market needs
Limited access to internships, entrepreneurship, and professional opportunities
Insufficient teaching equipment and digital infrastructure
Psychological stress and lack of mental health services
Difficulty accessing academic and administrative information
methodes: Consultations with student associations and universities
Establishment of observatories to monitor student paths
Partnership with private sector and local businesses
Territorial diagnosis of university infrastructure needs
Awareness-raising for public actors about student realities
Creation of dialogue forums between students and institutions
solutions: Establishment of scholarships and preferential-rate student loans
Construction and rehabilitation of accessible university residences
Curriculum revision to better respond to market needs
Creation of internship centers, incubators, and university fablabs
Equipment of universities with digital libraries and modern laboratories
Establishment of psychological listening cells and preventive health services
Digitization of university administrative services (registrations, scholarships, etc.)

problemes: Multiplicity of uncoordinated taxes and fiscal charges
Limited access to financing for small traders
Lack of training in management, accounting, and marketing
Insecurity in markets and commercial areas
Inadequate commercial infrastructure (stalls, warehouses, access roads)
Unfair competition with low-quality imported products
Instability of local commercial policies and lack of protection for small businesses
methodes: Regular consultations with trade unions and associations
Diagnosis of distribution circuits and local taxation
Partnerships with microfinance institutions and local banks
Establishment of support cells for formalization of small businesses
Continuous training for traders in management and digital skills
Dialogue between local authorities and traders for adapted reforms
solutions: Reform of local taxation to simplify and harmonize taxes
Creation of microcredit funds specific to small traders
Construction and rehabilitation of markets with security and hygiene
Implementation of business management training programs
Protection of local products against unfair external competition
Digitization of business management (mobile payments, local e-commerce)
Simplified formalization program for informal small traders

problemes: Low wages compared to cost of living
Frequent delays in salary payments, especially in public or informal sector
Non-compliance with labor code and absence of formal contracts for many workers
Poor access to social protection (CNPS, health insurance, retirement)
Precarious working conditions and lack of workplace safety
Limited career development prospects and lack of continuous training
Weakened unionism and poor representation of employees in social dialogue
methodes: Strengthened social dialogue between State, employers, and unions
Audits on hiring and remuneration practices in companies
Partnership with social security institutions for awareness
Information campaigns on workers' rights
Encouraging companies to invest in vocational training
Strengthening union capacities for better representation
solutions: Revaluation of SMIG (guaranteed interprofessional minimum wage)
Establishment of control mechanisms to guarantee regular salary payments
Mandatory written contracts for all employment, including informal sector
Simplification of CNPS enrollment and creation of universal health coverage for employees
Regular inspection of workplaces for safety standard compliance
Creation of subsidized continuous training centers for employees
Strengthening of tripartite social dialogue (State - Employers - Unions)

problemes: Lack of official recognition of skills acquired through experience
Limited access to continuous technical training and certification
Difficulty accessing financing to develop their activity
Poor social coverage and absence of formal work contracts
Unfair competition from unqualified or foreign providers
Absence of platforms for client connection
Precarious working conditions and exposure to professional risks
methodes: National census of specialized workers by sector
Collaboration with vocational training centers (CFP, IFORD, etc.)
Implementation of skills validation programs (VAE)
Dialogue between cooperatives, artisans, and local authorities
Awareness-raising on social protection and workplace safety
Encouragement of formalization through tax incentives
solutions: Creation of a national certification program for artisanal skills
Subsidy or free training for obtaining qualifying diplomas (CAP, CQP)
Establishment of micro-credits and grants for tool and material purchase
Simplified registration of workers in cooperatives or professional registers
Digital or physical platforms to facilitate visibility and client connection
Health and retirement insurance adapted to independent workers
Promotion campaigns for specialized trades among youth and general public

problemes: Lack of means of subsistence, material and health needs
Under-schooling or absence of schooling
Uncertain or non-existent future
Insufficient reception and support structures adapted for orphans
Social stigma and marginalization of orphans in some communities
Limited access to education, health, and civil status (birth certificates)
Lack of psychosocial follow-up and emotional support
Economic precariousness leading to exploitation or early work
methodes: Legislative proposal, Participatory approach / Co-construction
National mapping of orphans and existing reception structures
Community consultations and involvement of traditional and religious leaders
Networking of reception centers and harmonization of practices
Training of supervisory staff in psychosocial and protective approaches
Development of specific legal framework for orphan children
Collaboration with NGOs and social partners for community sponsorship
Longitudinal follow-up of orphan children until socio-professional insertion
solutions: Legislative proposal for special orphan status with special advantages for all public services (school, hospital, commercial center, administrative documents)
Strengthening capacities of orphanage educators
Implementation of a diaspo-social and CSR program benefiting orphanages
Systematic issuance of birth certificates and facilitated civil registration
Establishment of a national solidarity fund for orphan protection
Social sponsorship program (remunerated and supervised foster families)
Psychosocial support with social assistance, psychologists, and specialized educators
Progressive professional insertion with training, scholarships, and micro-credits
National awareness campaigns to combat stigma

problemes: Under-schooling or absence of schooling
Social precariousness / Absence of employment
Poor child care or abandonment
Social stigma and family rejection of young single mothers
School dropout or difficulty continuing studies after maternity
Lack of access to adapted sexual and reproductive health services
Economic precariousness and absence of financial autonomy
Absence of reception structures or daycare centers to allow resumption of studies or work
Increased risk of exploitation, gender-based violence, and recurrent early pregnancies
Poor consideration of the issue in public policies
methodes: Participatory approach / Co-construction
Community listening and participatory surveys with concerned young mothers
Mobilization of local actors (chiefs, educators, parents, women's associations)
Creation of discussion groups and psychological support for young mothers
Awareness campaigns in schools and communities on rights and dignity of young mothers
Partnerships with vocational training centers, health centers, and NGOs
Establishment of social referents in schools and health facilities
Integration of young mothers' needs in municipal development plans
solutions: Support for obtaining MINFOP training scholarships
Support for job search and placement with employers
Negotiation with Ministry of Social Affairs for recognition of exceptional social status for young mothers with effect on priority child care
Facilitated school reintegration with specific scholarships and individualized support
Creation of reception and reinsertion centers for young mothers
Establishment of free community daycare centers near training centers or schools
Free access to maternal, child, and psychological health care
Qualifying training and funding for self-employment projects or local cooperatives
Law protecting against educational and professional discrimination of young mothers
Massive destigmatization campaigns through media, schools, and public places
Creation of a special fund for empowerment of vulnerable young mothers

problemes: Family disputes (alimony, forced remarriage)
Land disputes (expropriation)
Child school dropout/social precariousness
Discrimination and social marginalization after spouse's death
Property grabbing by in-laws, especially in rural areas
Absence of effective legal protection of inheritance rights
Poor access to economic resources and employment
Lack of psychological and social support after bereavement
Non-existence of targeted public assistance mechanisms for widows
Double parenting burden without specific support
methodes: Legislative proposal, Participatory approach / Co-construction
Census of widows and identification of their specific needs by locality
Community dialogue with traditional chiefs and religious leaders to break taboos
Strengthening capacities of social and legal services to respond to widowhood situations
Creation of listening, mutual aid, and advocacy platforms led by widows themselves
Work with customary and civil courts for securing widows' rights
Technical support to existing widows' associations for better coordination
Integration of widows' issues in national poverty reduction strategies
solutions: Constitution of a pro bono legal council
Strengthening understanding of land rights
Support for schooling through an expanded school sponsorship program
Adoption of a clear and protective law on widows' rights and inheritance
Creation of a special fund for economic and social support of widows
Establishment of listening and psychological monitoring centers in each department
Support for widows' entrepreneurship through dedicated funding and training
Priority access program for widows to social housing and health coverage
National campaigns against stigmatization and spoliation of widows
Free legal support to assert their inheritance and family rights
Insertion of widows in local cooperatives or community employment programs

problemes: Investment and entrepreneurship difficulties in home country
Poor recognition and valorization of diaspora skills
Limited access to administrative and legal information in Cameroon
Difficulties in political participation (voting, representation, dialogue)
Lack of support for voluntary return or reintegration
methodes: Creation of a Diaspora Consultative Council
Establishment of a digital one-stop shop for diaspora
Launch of a 'structured and secure return' program
Regular organization of diaspora-government dialogue forums
Creation of a special fund to support diaspora projects
solutions: Valorization of diaspora skills in local development projects
Temporary tax exemptions for diaspora entrepreneurs
Effective implementation of secure electronic voting for Cameroonians abroad
Creation of diaspora attaches in embassies and consulates responsible for relaying concerns and projects of Cameroonians abroad
Development of a special diaspora real estate program supported by the State, with regulated legal and financial guarantees

problemes: Absence of effective retirement system for majority of elderly people
Difficult access to health care adapted to their age
Social isolation and frequent family abandonment
Lack of reception infrastructure or day centers for elderly
Vulnerability to poverty and food insecurity
Non-recognition of their role and knowledge in society
Absence of specific public policies for the elderly
methodes: Identification and census of vulnerable elderly by locality
Consultation with families, neighborhood chiefs, and community leaders
Partnership with health centers, mutuals, NGOs, and churches
Development of a national policy for elderly well-being
Establishment of municipal committees to monitor elderly well-being
Community awareness-raising on family care for elders
solutions: Establishment of a special social support fund for elderly without pension
Free or subsidized health care for seniors in public hospitals
Creation of day reception and activity centers for elderly
Targeted food program for vulnerable elderly
Recognition and valorization of elders' role in social mediation and cultural transmission
Home visit initiatives and community listening
Integration of elderly in intergenerational programs (mentoring, crafts, agriculture)

problemes: Lack of legal assistance
Inhumane living conditions
Complex post-detention reintegration
Chronic prison overcrowding and inhumane detention conditions
Lack of access to basic health care, hygiene, and sufficient food
Slowness of judicial procedures causing high proportion of pre-trial detainees
Absence of structured social and professional reintegration programs
Stigmatization of ex-detainees upon release, limiting their reintegration
Insufficient trained prison staff and logistical means
Recurrent violation of detainees' fundamental rights
methodes: Participatory approach / Co-construction
Independent national evaluation of detention conditions and prison system
Consultation with judicial actors, human rights NGOs, and former detainees
Continuous training of guards and criminal justice actors
Establishment of a national ethics and prison monitoring committee
Creation of partnerships between prison administration, civil society, and private sector
Strengthening capacities of courts to accelerate case processing
Promotion of restorative justice and alternative sentences to imprisonment
solutions: Constitution of a universal pro bono legal council
Establishment of an annual fundraising program for detainees' social assistance
Offer of guidance and training scholarships for former detainees with guaranteed socio-professional reintegration
Construction and rehabilitation of penitentiary institutions to human standards
Decongestion of prisons through strict application of pre-trial detention deadlines
Implementation of literacy, training, and work programs in prison
Systematic medical monitoring of detainees with access to mental and physical care
National reintegration program with psychological support and professional insertion
Legal protection of ex-detainees against discrimination in hiring and housing
Modernization of judicial system with digitization of criminal procedures
Creation of a prison dignity fund financed by State and partners

problemes: Difficult working conditions and lack of adapted equipment (vehicles, bulletproof vests, radios, etc.)
Remuneration often considered insufficient relative to risks incurred
Lack of continuous training in human rights and conflict management
Negative perception and distrust of part of population towards FMO
Exposure to psychological risks (post-traumatic stress, isolation)
Delays in payment of mission or special operation bonuses
Inadequacy between operational needs and available logistics
methodes: Participative evaluation with FMO on field realities
Institutional dialogue between FMO corps and supervising ministries
Regular audits of allocations and available equipment
Establishment of psychological and social monitoring cells
Partnership with training and capacity building organizations
Consultation of populations on their expectations towards FMO
solutions: Improvement of working conditions: housing, equipment, secure transport
Revaluation of salaries and regular payment of risk or mission bonuses
Strengthening continuous training in ethics, crowd management, and human rights
Establishment of a national psychological support program for FMO
Creation of a mixed observatory (State - civil society - FMO) to monitor civil-military relations
Communication campaigns to restore FMO image among citizens
Digitization of administrative and logistic management systems (bonuses, assignments, evaluations)

problemes: Low salaries compared to cost of living and responsibility level
Delays in integration, tenure, or administrative advancement
Slowness in processing administrative files (advancement, pension, transfer)
Lack of motivation due to absence of performance bonuses or objective evaluation
Insufficient continuous training and inadequacy with technological evolutions
Precarious working conditions in some administrations (dilapidated premises, obsolete equipment)
Favoritism, corruption, or clientelism in career management
methodes: Internal surveys and satisfaction polls in public services
Concertation between unions, ministries, and personnel departments
Diagnosis of administrative management systems and HR tools
Evaluation of training needs by professional groups
Creation of channels for denouncing and monitoring abuses or delays
Development of dashboards for monitoring administrative performance
solutions: Complete digitization of HR processes (recruitment, advancement, pension)
Establishment of one-stop shop for personnel administrative procedures
Progressive salary revaluation by priority categories and sectors
Creation of a bonus system based on performance and ethics
Renovation of offices and equipment with modern computer material
Mandatory continuous training in each sector every 2 to 3 years
Strengthening transparency and meritocracy in career management

problemes: Financing
Staff qualification
Access to local and international markets
Difficulty accessing financing, especially for young entrepreneurs and SMEs
Administrative slowness and complexity of business creation procedures
Poor support in training, mentoring, and business management
Insufficient innovation support infrastructure (incubators, coworking spaces)
High and unpredictable tax burden for small structures
Lack of legal protection for local innovations
Poor access to public markets and export opportunities
methodes: Participatory approach / Co-construction
Concertation with entrepreneurs, chambers of commerce, and local incubators
Reduction of administrative barriers by digitizing creation and management procedures
Establishment of entrepreneurship one-stop shops by region
Creation of mentoring and experience sharing platforms
Development of national databases on SMEs and startups
Strategic partnerships with banks and impact investment funds
Development of an incentive tax policy for young enterprises
solutions: Implementation of the Diasponariat Program (Shareholding, Guarantee Fund, Shared Acquisition, Networking and Business Alliance)

Census of struggling micro, small and medium enterprises through a registration platform called AccèsEntreprise then organization 4 times a year of 4 webinars for capacity building, skills, attitudes and staff performance

Awareness for entrepreneurs to register with chambers of commerce and employers' associations, facilitation for access and participation in international meetings to establish partnerships or enrich perspectives
Creation of a National Fund for Youth and Female Entrepreneurship Support (FONAEJF)
Simplification and reduction of business creation delays to less than 48h
Establishment of regional innovation, incubation, and coworking hubs
National entrepreneurship training program from secondary school and in universities
Priority access for SMEs to public markets with reserved quotas
Temporary tax exemptions for startups and micro-enterprises
Strengthened protection of intellectual property of local products and innovations
Digital platform for connection with investors and external markets

problemes: Lack of structuring and legal recognition of digital actors' status
Limited access to reliable and affordable internet connection, especially in rural areas
Absence of clear and adapted tax framework for digital activities (e-commerce, influence, freelancing)
Poor access to financing for local digital projects
Little institutional support for digital innovation or tech startups
Plagiarism and non-respect of intellectual property on digital content
Lack of practical training in digital development, digital marketing, cybersecurity
methodes: Census of digital actors and mapping of digital communities by city
Organization of consultation forums between creators, authorities, and telecom operators
Dialogue with tax administrations to adapt regulations
Partnerships between State, incubators, universities, and digital companies
Support for establishment of regional digital hubs
Awareness campaigns on digital rights and intellectual property
solutions: Creation of specific legal status for freelancers, creators, and tech startups
Subsidy of internet access for young digital project holders
Development of a simplified tax code for digital activities
Funding of micro-digital projects through innovation funds or national competitions
Establishment of training and coworking centers in regions
Strengthening legal framework on cybersecurity and digital rights
Annual organization of a National Digital Fair to valorize local talents
